alternatives.transcript: hello everyone I hope you're enjoying the conference I'm glad to have an opportunity to address you this year and where the business stands and bring you up to speed versus last year when we talked let's start by talking about the overall company objective and the overall company objective is to be a strong number two and that is the same objective we talked about last year for the company B to be the strong number two player in the industry we have four core strategies to get us there and

so the same four core strategies we discussed last year briefly let me talk about those for the first is to grow our share of Market with equity-based Brands that's brands that really stand for an idea in the marketplace that competitive smokers are switching to and come to because they have meaningful differentiated points positioning points of difference our second course strategy is innovative trade programs that's retailer and wholesale or programs that enable us to

put our brands in store in a positive light so we can deliver our advertising message so we can put promotions up that in that draw competitive smokers to Our Brands our third course strategy is rigorous cost controls and this is a very important strategy for the company because the more efficient we can run this business the more money we can invest back into the business and growing our share of market and finally our fourth core strategy is to
over increased earnings and cash flow which are required by any investor

now let's take a look at how we have performed this year so far on a volume basis year-to-date our volume is off by about 4% this is in line with the industry decline of about three point seven percent this year our net sales are up 13 percent that's primarily due to price increases that have taken place over the last 12 months are operating company contribution or profit is up two percent

again due to price increases offset in some part by reduced volume and settlement expenses now let's turn to our investment Branch here because that's what it's all about how are we doing on the key Brands where we are investing and trying to grow share of market and just to recap those three brands are Winston camel and Darrell let's start with Winston because that's the most dramatic Story versus last year when I talked with you as

you know Winston had been a declining brand for over 25 years as you can see here Winston's decline since 1994 has averaged about .25 per year each and every year but in 1998 year-to-date Winston is up .13 share and on-base Winston Styles it's actually up over three tenths of a share the reason for that is we reposition Winston in August of last year

with a whole new campaign the noble no additives campaign that has really made competitive smokers take notice of Winston again I won't go into more detail now on Winston because the head of Winston Ned Leary will be up to take you through the whole idea and what progress were making with on it but suffice to say we have turned Winston around and that is a major accomplishment in the last year for this company now let's take a look at camel

I'm camel camel has been growing since 1988 when we reposition the brand with the Joe Camel can't paint you can see that over the past few years camels average growth per year has been about 3 tons of a share of Market in 1997 last year the brand was up .46 sharepoint's a very strong year for Camel year-to-date 1998 camel is up about .14 sharepoint's a little slower

growth and we have been experienced historically the reason for that is Phillip Morris has seen us make progress on Winston they saw the dramatic growth on Camel last year and has come on strong with very heavy promotion slowing the growth some on Camel although the brand is still growing our third key investment brand is Darrell Darrell is a real success story Darrell has had strong share of Market great gains for many years now and as you can see

see Darrell's average gain year in and year out is almost a half a share point and in fact 1998 year-to-date Doral has up 0.55 sharepoint's demonstrating the Brand's real Vitality in the marketplace it is the number one savings brand and is growing faster than any other savings brand so very strong performance and contributing to our overall Company Success

when you look at our three investment brands in total Winston camel and Doral you can see that our year-to-date share gain on these three brands is .82 it's a very strong story that our strategy of focusing on brands with potential is working so that fully 17 share points of our 25 share points as an overall company are in these three investment Brands and they are gaining share

if you look at the total company despite the growth on Winston camel and Darrell of .82 the overall company is down slightly and share total RJ are being off point one three share points and that's due to the declines on the non-investment brands you can see that Salem has declined year-to-date .27 other full price down .24 and other savings down .44 now the real goal for our company is to have our

total RJ our share of Market growing if you look at these declines on this chart you can see that if we had Salem in the plus column along with Winston camel and Doral then our total RJ our share of Market would be a positive story in fact we have been test marketing a new Salem proposition since last year since fourth quarter last year and the results look very good in fact Salem is showing share of market gains in the

this Market the key question for us is a company is can we add Salem to our portfolio of investment Brands without taking away from the support we give Winston camel and drought if we lose on those three brands by adding Salem then we have not made the company better off as a whole so we will be selectively rolling Salem out in other markets next year Rhonda plumber who is now that vice president of Salem will be taking you through that process

opposition and where we intend to go with it next year but we are going to a limited geography to ensure that we can add Salem without taking away from Winston camel and Doral now that's sort of the picture of where our business stands this year year to date it's a relatively positive story and that we continue to make progress are in on our investment Brands and we have the potential to add Salem to that list of

Brands however we Face three key Marketplace challenges for the rest of this year and 1999 those three challenges our first of all our ability to continue to gain full price market share in the face of a new Philip more strategy second key threat is substantial price increases that have made adult smokers increasingly more price sensitive and the third challenge

Inge is new low price brands that threaten our position and drowse position in the low end let me talk about each of these let's start with Philip Morris's new strategy Philip Morris has seen our company make progress on Winston camel and drought they recognize that RJ Reynolds is the only company that presents a true threat to their market dominance as a result of the progress we have made Philip Morris is coming on very strong

thin objective to dominate the US market they have increased their spending substantially in order to dominate presence in stores and with dramatically increased promotion as a result of those moves they have been able in the most recent months to slow our share of market gains we currently are developing a response to their new strategies and putting new initiatives in place to try and overcome this threat that is currently facing us

us the second key Marketplace challenge is the substantial price increases we have seen over the last 12 months these price increases have come from manufacturers to cover litigation and settlement expenses they have come from State excise taxes as well the impact us as a company is that full price smokers currently smoking Our Brands adult smokers are becoming more sensitive to the price of cigarettes and some

are switching down to lower priced brands so it is imperative that we continue to develop programs that insulate our franchise from switching to other brands or switching to low price Brands and we are also working on those initiatives the third key Marketplace challenge we have is the new low priced here as a result of the substantial price increases in the marketplace there are new Renegade players in the marketplace small companies that are

offering on brands that didn't exist a year ago for up to two dollars and seventy cents a carton lower than our lowest-priced Brands retailers have an incentive to go with a low price Brands because they are dry trying to drive consumer traffic to their stores this presents the potential for these Brands to gain wider distribution and threaten particularly Darrell's dominant position in the saving segment

This Thread is going to cause us to spend more on Darrell to Defender else position but be assured that we are working on that and do intend to defend around that gives you a summary picture where we are we have our same company strategy in place that is to be a strong number two we are making progress against it we certainly are facing Marketplace challenges but we are working with initiatives to overcome those

so I say to you good luck with all the challenges you face and I look forward to speaking to you next year and being able to report more progress against our objectives thank you hi there my name is Ned Leary I'm the vice president of the Winston business unit Lyn beazley covered some of the success we've had with Winston over the past few months and what I want to do is simply detail a little bit of the performance and show you what you can expect from Winston coming up over the next year

let's start with what we've seen on base Winston as you can see from this graph and it only starts about mid last year base Winston's historic decline of over probably 20 years stopped last year when we launched the repositioning and as this graph highlights we gain significant share in the second half of last year and have flattened out again those of you that are aware of Winston's historical decline will recognize this graph

Winston is nothing short of a minor miracle importantly where these gains came from are in the all-important convenience store class of trade as you can see from this graph it's a similar picture we've gained significant share there and we've held our own importantly the gains that Winston has seen over the past few months have come in the Box category as you may or may not know box has been growing in this industry for years

ears and soft pack has been declining unfortunately 80% of Winston's businesses soft pack so we are particularly pleased to see the Box business take off like it has and as you can see most of our games have come from box also important is where is this business coming from as this chart highlights before the repositioning 12% of Winston's business was in the 21 to 34 year old age group over 80% was in the 35 Plus age group since

repositioning we've gone from 12% 21 to 34 to 21 percent 21 to 34 and in the critical box segment half of our gains were coming from 21 to 34 age adult smokers now with games like this it is to be expected that they're not happening in a vacuum Marlboro and Philip Morris have been keeping a close eye on Winston and is this graph illustrates when we were putting the biggest points on the board

ORD in the second half of last year Marlborough was relatively flat they will not stand for that type of performance on that brand and as a result they have turned up the promotional Heat at retail to unprecedented levels and as you can see they've been able to resume their growth and unfortunately they've been successful installing Winston's gains so with a competitor with the girth of Marlborough you have to ask yourself how can we as a smaller company and a smaller brand

Pete the answer is very simple we have to continue to shine the floodlights on our positioning the positioning is the only strength we have relative to Marlborough and time after time talking to adult smokers the positioning is hitting home so what we have to do is to continue to strive to have the highest talk value with this positioning the most relevant and the most motivating message on the landscape let me start with some advertising to show you how we're going to continue to move forward as you can

see from this sad old man should stick to hitting on old women perhaps particularly relevant in today's market here's another one that gets at the noble attitude judge me all you want just keep the verdict to yourself one that's coming up it's running right now and obviously it's very topical given the elections is the bull stops here that with the voting booth pictured we also have another campaign called the alternative campaign that runs in more targeted edgy books here's an ad

running now and vehicles such as Rolling Stone and details magazine this one says when I say no additives I mean no additives another ad that's running in these type magazines with a little bit more edges if you're wearing one of these you'd better be swimming for metal yet another one poking a little fun at the popularity of 19-hundred psychic lines this one says if they're so psychic why don't they call you

one that's about to run in the next few months spoofing a little bit of the Hallmark situation here's a card that says I never really loved you and the line is maybe there shouldn't be a card for every occasion and finally one that says obviously it shows a box where someone has packed up their office and it says at least now you know not to tell that joke in meetings anymore

a critical part of Winston's marketing is our involvement in Motorsports and if you follow them at all I hope you will agree that we've taken Motorsports to a new level and quite frankly for the first time in our 25-year involvement we've now got a positioning that enables us to leverage the appeal of Motorsports and make it work for Winston and the line we often use is depicted here on this logo is 100% racing no bull we sponsor teams as well as series starting with just a couple of the

the teams we sponsor riding our Pro Stock Motorcycle is a young lady by the name of angelle ceiling and is this ad says why would a 110-pound woman climb on a motorcycle and run 180 miles an hour in the answer is simple because she can we will also continue next year our sponsorship with Jimmy Spencer and the number 23 no bull Ford Ford Taurus and in the event that Jimmy wins which they're working hard to do we'll run an ad like this says from junkyard to

Victory Lane we will also continue a program that we think has been extremely successful for us and that's the Winston Noble 5 where 5 drivers will compete at five races for a total purse of five million dollars is this ad says see five grown men fight over a purse the Winston Noble five million dollar bonus there's also a fan component to this and we've given away this year 2 million dollars to fans and will give another million dollars away in the month of December

I to a fan due to the fact that Dale Jarrett one the the Winston 500 at Talladega another ad we've run as part of the noble five as you probably are aware Jeff Gordon has one near about every race on the circuit this year so we ran an ad in preparation for Talladega that says doesn't anybody but Gordon want our money and in and in fact someone did Dale Jarrett walked away with a million dollars another program we're going to be doing next year to try and highlight the noble nature of Winston is the Winston Blues

evil this is a program that features older blues artists that have not ever made it to the big time and in many cases quite honestly they're destitute and there is a organization in Greensboro called The Music Maker relief foundation and what they do is help these artists literally live and what we've done is gone in and working with them we're going to be sponsoring some of these artists touring the country and is this ad says the blues aren't something you can keep inside they have to come out on the balcony

porch another one this is a gentleman actually from Winston-Salem he's deceased now but his name is guitar Gabriel and his line is I've played so much guitar and make your ass hurt as you can see on these two one of the these speak to the Winston Blues Revival tour which will be touring in about 15 or 16 cities all the proceeds go to the music maker relief foundation and what we like about this is it really highlights the noble nature of Winston and we like to say it's an
sample of us walking the talk or putting our money where our mouth is

let me close with just a few Billboards one that we got a lot of positive feedback on why do politicians smoke cigars while taxing cigarettes I know we crossed a little bit of a riff with some in the cigar industry but we think the point was very germane to that point in time and it's probably one of our most popular boards another one you'll see running is the bull stops here followed by see no bull here no bull take no bull and then lastly one that you'll be happy to know will not run but I thought I'd
leave it with you no more Monica no more Bill no more bull thank you very much and I hope this gives you a good sense for where we're headed with Winston

hi I'm Fran Creighton and I'm here to talk to you about the marketing plans we have set in place for the camel brand in 1999 let's start with the new camel advertising you've more than likely seen or heard about in the past few months the mighty tasty advertising has created a lot of talk value within our company as well as with adult smokers across the u.s. I'd like to take a few minutes to give you some background on those changes we've seen in today's culture that prompted the development of these new ads
have you noticed how much things have changed in movies television and advertising in just the last decade take a look

we've gone from the conventional family there marshmallows on a stick you put them in the fire to a household that's out of this world from the best of friends and I need you there with me every step of the way to the strangest of companions that's it it's go time
from discussion with open arms to Armed dissension in the open

you know our society is changing right before our very eyes today people are more skeptical less naive and nowhere is that more apparent than with 21 to 34 year old adult smokers they are smarter and more Savvy about what they see in the media but they still want to be entertained we gotta show that we realize they are clued into what's hip or we lose their attention think about the ad you've seen lately that you like their
but sarcastic they're often funny but you still get a real message about the brand watch
so do you call yourself Mary Lou or Lou yes all the time or is it a yes it was a no yes

and you can see it a magazine advertising as well adults today want to see our ties in that flies in the face of conventions they want to see the unexpected and they're smart enough to get it so we don't have to hit them over the head anymore with the traditional message by my product be like me check it out today you have to break away from conventions and deliver the unexpected you must have a visual style which is
an intense and you gotta have an attitude that's fun and a little irreverent this kind of user imagery just isn't going to work anymore

camels new campaign fits in with today's pop culture it's fun irreverent and definitely unexpected and it's the kind of innovation camel needs in order to grow the camel campaign addresses adult smokers jaded point of view when it comes to advertising in fact the ads are a spoof of popular myths social conventions and traditional user imagery itself they tend

reality and add exaggerated details the viewer discretion advised box tells adult smokers that these ads are a joke and clues them into important details to linger over adult smokers see it as entertaining humorous and intelligent and the mighty tasty message delivers an attitude about product superiority in a mighty imaginative way so keep an eye out for the new camel campaign it's changed
and that's why it works

we're pleased with the positive response we've seen among adult smokers to the new camel ads and beginning this month were launching a special promotion whose objective is to engage adult smokers in Camel's new mighty tasty world it's called the mighty tasty lifestyle sweepstakes this sweepstakes promotion has the same tongue-in-cheek attitude as the advertising in that it creates a spoof of All Sweepstakes promotions camo sweeps
takes offers adult smokers the opportunity to win one of four mighty tasty Lifestyles here is one of the lifestyles a winner may choose

welcome to the mighty tasty lifestyle of the temperament all it would make a staff is Tom and his Dodge Viper convertible which he likes to ride to the coast for John to his cigarette boat Oregon Carriage these vehicles from speed Glamour and power for a little downtime at Hollywood's it Hotel bar Mondrian
but now lifestyle would be complete without the seat satisfaction that comes from owning your own nightclub for one week complete with cell phones

in addition to the irreverent fun of the new advertising and latest promotion Kamala is launching new retail advertising that establishes a bold updated look while maintaining strong identification of the camel brand trademark

to combat the high degree of promotion and pricing by our competitors camel will look to continue our tradition of unique promotion in retail stores we will have quarterly buy two get one free offers in 1999 as well as event promotions like the mighty tasty lifestyle sweepstakes and we are launching a special package promotion in the form of a unique camel 10 that makes a positive statement about the brand in a high-quality package

camel cash and camels direct marketing programs remain strong vehicles for retention of adult franchise smokers as well as switching of adult competitive smokers did you know that 60% of adult camel smoker safe camel cash and over half of the adult smokers who switched to camel from other brands are camel cash players in 1999 camel will launch a new cash catalog with unique and high quality merchandise to continue this important program
and camel will mail direct marketing programs throughout the year to qualified adult smokers

switching adult competitive smokers to camel is key to our ability to achieve share growth in the future for the brand and there are several important programs where we've been able to accomplish real switching and share growth these include the camel biker wrote house tour program where we take camel to the nation's largest

biker rallies the camel amateur and Pro Series pool program where camel is part of weekly Billiards league play as well as Regional and National tournaments and the Camel Club program which has ongoing presence and product sales in clubs across 30 major Metropolitan markets all of camels event marketing programs are conducted in age-restricted venues and give us the opportunity to reinforce camel strong Equity with continuous advertising and product
residence and to a switch adult smokers to the brand through one-on-one personal sales here's a snapshot of these unique events the best entertainment experience that you will ever find anywhere

that concludes our brief look at camels marketing programs I hope you know that all of us on the camel brand appreciate the hard work you are doing to protect our ability to Market our products to adult smokers please let us know if there's anything we can do to help out
out thank you
